> 10 minutes ago, The Raging Sandwich said:

> My tiny asteroid moon and the base inside of it survives. I send my troops to capture Solo, Chewie, the traitor, and the hologram.
>

I knew I was being nice by letting you have the sub gilly moon. Willing to share the base? Have the planet cracker (well, one that doesn't take a week to charge) right here, just need to plug it into the USB port there.

rebels you say?  
  
![latest?cb=20130208032337](http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cf/Knightfall2.png/revision/latest?cb=20130208032337)

I assemble my tech on the asteroidal moon base, and shield/cloak the planet just in time. I then carefully line up a gravioli disruptor shot and take down the troop transports.

[@The Raging Sandwich](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/164377-the-raging-sandwich/)'s planet and base. Under my protection, though.
![47067641.jpg](https://cdn.meme.am/instances/500x/47067641.jpg)

Ya, but the planet is *cloaked* in all spectrums except gravitic. Have fun finding it, the only troop transport that knew its location is now a few stray photons wandering the cosmos.

And the cloaking generator is *inside* the cloak, if you were wondering.

[@The Raging Sandwich](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/164377-the-raging-sandwich/), how about an alliance? I keep the shield up, you get the planet buster?

if one can use the force to shoot torpedoes through a small vent, force choke through a monitor, or SENSE THAT YOUR SON IS ABOARD A SHIP, it can easily be used to find out where's the base... so I find out where it is and send an imperial troop over there ![latest?cb=20091202184047](http://vignette1.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/Battle_of_Hoth.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20091202184047) (this brings up the question though, why the heck did they send drones to find the rebel base?)

> 
> 
> 10 minutes ago, JoseEduardo said:
> 
> 
> (this brings up the question though, why the heck did they send drones to find the rebel base?)
> 

Because *the Force does not make you omnipresent!* The Force users could probably only scan one system at a time. Because the base is so sparsely populated, you need to be rather close to it to be able to sense the Force ripples.

It's not good form to refuse to acknowledge defeat, though, so - fine, you find the base and collapse the shield.

Your planet.

Your Starkiller.

Your field of crushed Star Destroyers marking out where the shield used to be.

Your asteroidal base tokamak reactor about to go critical.

(added later)

Oh, and one more thing!

Your star-crushing planet-sized superweapon ***slowly disintegrating into gravioli energy from the failsafe device!***

Have fun.

as a celebration I call Jeb to bring this base somewhere else  

the resultant ~~crash site~~ hill is now mine, [@Wildcat111](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/165926-wildcat111/)'s and [@TheEpicSquared](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/158667-theepicsquared/)'s

The base was taken over and destroyed a while ago, its the crater now.

I use an alternate reality wormhole thingy to travel to Middle-Earth. Then I claim the Weathertop as my hill!

Everyone can keep their hills or whatever the actual hell they have now.

I rebuild a bigger and better base on my moon and attach a cluster of ion engines to get the heck out of there!

[@greenTurtle1134](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167701-greenturtle1134/) and my moon.

Wanting more mass, I rip Weathertop with [@ZentroCatson](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/143939-zentrocatson/) on it into our 'verse and smack it into our moon.

My moon shared equally with [@The Raging Sandwich](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/164377-the-raging-sandwich/), now with a tenant and an atmosphere.

Might wanna stay here... we have running water and a fusion reactor!

(Edit)

And of course I build a cloak, shield, and gravioli gun!

(more edit)

[@The Raging Sandwich](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/164377-the-raging-sandwich/), just shut off the ion drives, with their low thrust and the roid's high mass they're useless. Save us some energy and radiation.

More tech and equal shares.

*Says the magic word*

Nothing happens...

Darn.

I build a neutrino gun and zap the mun, killing everyone on it with a lethal dose of neutrino radiation.

I build a hill on Kerbin. My hill.

DISCLAIMER: the magic word is not "Please".

[@greenTurtle1134](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/167701-greenturtle1134/) , [@The Raging Sandwich](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/164377-the-raging-sandwich/) and me get revived by Mercy. Now we build a huge interplanetary ship and fly to Kerbin, then we attack icantmakemodels's hill and claim it as our own!

Our hill.
So as long as we're playing with characters from class-based shooters, I call in engie who builds a sentry and mows all you guys down. We then climb the hill and take it over. My hill.

I push the red button the game resets completely 

now i claim a hill that has a purple and orange button

I push both the purple and orange button at the same time which self-destructs the entire hill.

My moderately-sized chunk of rock.

I install buttons of various colors as well as a biometric (fingerprint, retinal scan and genetic profile) ID system to turn them on, keyed to me and [@The Raging Sandwich](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/164377-the-raging-sandwich/).

 Our hill. I sweep the rubble up a bit.

My fellow homosapien sapien companions, friend or foe, according to the time zone we reside in, it appears to be aloft 12 o'clock P.M. This confirms that we must participate in an age old ritual in which two homosapien sapiens stand spinal column to spinal column, walk approximately 10 paces in the opposite direction as their partner, turn around at a 180 degree angle at a pace faster than usual for most homosapien sapiens, and lightly press the trigger of their equalizer, igniting the gunpowder within, causing a small explosion that forces the lead projectile commonly used in lethal firearms such as this, to expell outward at a lethal pace towards the intended target. Once this has been accomplished, i shall multi spin my firearm known as a revolver, a weapon that was first invented in the late 16th century Europe and eventually made its way to industrial production in the 1900's, and place it inside my leather holding place, specifically created to contain the firearm known as a revolver.

My hill.
